div.l: Aleyn̄ vp rist and thought or that it dawe
I woll go crepe in by my felawe
And fonde the cradle / with his honde anon̄
By god koth he all wrang I hade mysgon̄
Myn̄ hede is toty of my swynk to nyght
That makes me þat I go nat aryght
I wate wele by the Cradle I haue mysgaa
Here lyes the Myller and his wyf alswa
And forth he goth on twenty devyll way
Vn to the bed ther as the myller lay
He went haue cropen̄ by his felawe Iohn
And by the Myller͗e in he crape anon̄
And caught hym by the nek and soft he spake
He seid þᵘou Iohn þᵘou swynes hede / awake
For cristes soule / and here a noble game
For by that lord that called is seint Iame
As I haue thryes in this shorte nyght
Swyfed the Myllers doughter / bolt vpright
While þᵘou hast as a Coward ben̄ agast
Ye false harlot koth the Miller͗e hast
A false traytoᵘur fals Clerk koth he
Þᵘou shalt be dede / by goddes dignytee
Who durst be so bold to disꝑparage
My doughter that is com̄ of soch lynage
And by the throte boll / he caught Aleyn̄
And he hent hym dispitously ageyn̄
And on̄ the nose / he smote hym wᵗith his fist
Doun̄ ran̄ þe blody streme vp on̄ his brest
And in þe flore / wᵗith nose and mouth to broke
They walwen / as done ·ij· pigges in a poke
And vp they gon̄ and doun̄ ageyn anon̄
Tyll þat the Myller spurned at a ston̄
And doun̄ he fyll bakward vp on̄ his wyf
That wist no thyng of this nyce stryf
For she was fall a slepe a litell wight
Wᵗith Iohn þe clerk that waked hade all nyght
And wᵗith the fall / out of hir slepe she breide
Help holy cros / of Bromeholm she seid
In manus tuas / lord to þe I call
A wake Symkyn̄ / the fende is on̄ me fall
Myn̄ hert is broken̄ / help I nam but dede
